001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.capture;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.PacketSource;
004import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.net.RawFrame;
005import ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.capture.libpcap.JnrPcapAdapter;
006import ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.capture.libpcap.Pcap;
007import ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.capture.libpcap.PcapHandle;
008import java.util.Objects;
009import java.util.Optional;
010import java.util.function.Supplier;
011
012/**
013 * PacketSource adapter backed by the existing JNR libpcap implementation. This is intentionally thin
014 * while the capture pipeline is migrated.
015 */
016public final class PcapPacketSource implements PacketSource {
017  private final String iface;
018  private final int snaplen;
019  private final boolean promiscuous;
020  private final int timeoutMillis;
021  private final int bufferBytes;
022  private final boolean immediate;
023  private final String filter;
024  private final Supplier<Pcap> pcapSupplier;
025
026  private Pcap pcap;
027  private PcapHandle handle;
028  private volatile boolean exhausted;
029
030  /**
031   * Creates a packet source without a capture filter.
032   *
033   * @param iface network interface name
034   * @param snaplen snap length in bytes
035   * @param promiscuous whether to enable promiscuous mode
036   * @param timeoutMillis poll timeout in milliseconds
037   * @param bufferBytes capture buffer size in bytes
038   * @param immediate whether to enable immediate mode
039   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
040   */
041  public PcapPacketSource(
042      String iface,
043      int snaplen,
044      boolean promiscuous,
045      int timeoutMillis,
046      int bufferBytes,
047      boolean immediate) {
048    this(iface, snaplen, promiscuous, timeoutMillis, bufferBytes, immediate, null);
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Creates a packet source with an optional BPF filter expression.
053   *
054   * @param iface network interface name
055   * @param snaplen snap length in bytes
056   * @param promiscuous whether to enable promiscuous mode
057   * @param timeoutMillis poll timeout in milliseconds
058   * @param bufferBytes capture buffer size in bytes
059   * @param immediate whether to enable immediate mode
060   * @param filter optional BPF filter expression; {@code null} or blank disables filtering
061   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
062   */
063  public PcapPacketSource(
064      String iface,
065      int snaplen,
066      boolean promiscuous,
067      int timeoutMillis,
068      int bufferBytes,
069      boolean immediate,
070      String filter) {
071    this(iface, snaplen, promiscuous, timeoutMillis, bufferBytes, immediate, filter, JnrPcapAdapter::new);
072  }
073
074  PcapPacketSource(
075      String iface,
076      int snaplen,
077      boolean promiscuous,
078      int timeoutMillis,
079      int bufferBytes,
080      boolean immediate,
081      String filter,
082      Supplier<Pcap> pcapSupplier) {
083    this.iface = Objects.requireNonNull(iface, "iface");
084    this.snaplen = snaplen;
085    this.promiscuous = promiscuous;
086    this.timeoutMillis = timeoutMillis;
087    this.bufferBytes = bufferBytes;
088    this.immediate = immediate;
089    this.filter = (filter == null || filter.isBlank()) ? null : filter;
090    this.pcapSupplier = Objects.requireNonNull(pcapSupplier, "pcapSupplier");
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Opens the libpcap handle for the configured interface.
095   *
096   * @throws Exception if libpcap initialization fails
097   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
098   */
099  @Override
100  public void start() throws Exception {
101    if (handle != null) {
102      return; // already started
103    }
104    this.pcap = pcapSupplier.get();
105    this.handle =
106        pcap.openLive(iface, snaplen, promiscuous, timeoutMillis, bufferBytes, immediate);
107    this.exhausted = false;
108    if (filter != null && !filter.isEmpty()) {
109      handle.setFilter(filter);
110    }
111  }
112
113  /**
114   * Polls for the next frame.
115   *
116   * @return captured frame when available; otherwise empty (including EOF)
117   * @throws Exception if libpcap reports an error
118   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
119   */
120  @Override
121  public Optional<RawFrame> poll() throws Exception {
122    if (handle == null) return Optional.empty();
123
124    final RawFrame[] captured = new RawFrame[1];
125    boolean keepRunning =
126        handle.next(
127            (tsMicros, data, caplen) -> {
128              byte[] copy = new byte[Math.max(0, caplen)];
129              if (caplen > 0) {
130                System.arraycopy(data, 0, copy, 0, caplen);
131              }
132              captured[0] = new RawFrame(copy, tsMicros);
133            });
134
135    if (!keepRunning) {
136      exhausted = true;
137      close();
138      return Optional.empty();
139    }
140
141    return Optional.ofNullable(captured[0]);
142  }
143
144  @Override
145  public boolean isExhausted() {
146    return exhausted;
147  }
148
149  /**
150   * Closes the capture handle and associated resources.
151   *
152   * @throws Exception if closing fails
153   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
154   */
155  @Override
156  public void close() throws Exception {
157    if (handle != null) {
158      handle.close();
159      handle = null;
160    }
161    if (pcap != null) {
162      pcap.close();
163      pcap = null;
164    }
165  }
166}
167
168
